content.description: Start low on a perfectly split rail, traverse up and right on the rail to its end, and make hard moves to gain the upper arete. Work the arete and marginal face features to a committing top off the deck.

Start back in the roof on an obvious jug slot. Climb crimps, heels, and slopers to da top!

Going left at lip is easier (V4??). The direct is the obvious line though using the sloper ladder, then deadpoint to the slot out right. There is fun stuff 'round here....
content.location:
There is a collection of boulders in the wash ~0.5 mile east of "Zig-Zag".

This one is directly in the wash facing "downstream" with GPS coordinates: 38° 2'48.67"N  108°46'4.26"W.

content.description: Do a high start on an overhung face with a great left hand rail and a small 2-finger pocket for your right. Work into a high right foot, paste your left, and dyno/lunge to the sloping lip with your right hand. Stabilize on the lip, and work straight up and over the highest point.
content.location:
The coordinates are 38.0265204851, -108.867030572.

It is nearer to Slick Rock, CO off near the Dolores River.

content.description: Follow the open book end of the boulder to a straightforward topout using small but positive holds.
content.location:
The coordinates are 38.0515952096, -108.768391351.

This ascends an obvious, open book, stem box on an isolated boulder.

content.description: Climb a right-leaning arete on good stone. Match on the arete, smear your feet, and work to the top.
Climb the sharp, overhanging arete to a mantel topout - watch the tree!
content.location:
This is directly behind

Delay's Problem

.

The GPS coordinates are 38.0410236934, -108.750166316.

content.description: Traverse a low, sloping lip from right-to-left before using a good sidepull and manteling to a ledge below the topout lip. The topout doesn't have great holds, and the mantel (2nd of the problem) is very scary, or at least I thought it was.

Do an awkward low start, pull into good sidepulls, and then climb a hard sequence of a gaston and high undercling before a long move to a sloping crimp just below the lip. This has an easy mantel topout.
content.location:
The GPS coordinates are 38.0409791815, -108.750102576.

It is just above the wash and is perched on a nice, flat landing.
